page.title: 15Burton Pidsea Carnival 1985
page.content: The Carnival was held this year on Sunday July 14th. It began with the parade of floats led by the Carnival Queen, Joanne Marjoram. For the first time a shield was to be presented for the Best-Dressed Float. This was won by the School's float - The Burton Pidsea School Circus. There were lots of stalls and other attractions. There were mini-motor bikes and swing-boats, an army assault course and target practice and there was music and a Cafe. There were lots of things to see and lots of things to be won. The biggest attraction was the horses. Apart from the showjumping,a lady called Jane, from Beverley, did a musical riding display.
